## Introduction
Grilled Lemon Butter Scallops are a delicious and elegant seafood dish. The combination of succulent scallops, tangy lemon, and rich butter creates a delightful flavor profile. This recipe is perfect for special occasions or a fancy dinner at home.

## Ingredients
- 1 pound (450g) fresh scallops
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted
- 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon lemon zest
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- Salt and black pepper to taste
- Fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)

## Equipment
- Grill or grill pan
- Tongs
- Mixing bowl
- Whisk
- Grater

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 6-8 minutes

## Steps
1. Preheat the grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, lemon juice, lemon zest, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper. Whisk until well combined.
3. Pat the scallops dry with a paper towel to remove any excess moisture.
4. Brush both sides of the scallops with the lemon butter mixture.
5. Place the scallops on the preheated grill or grill pan and cook for 3-4 minutes per side, or until they are opaque and have grill marks.
6. Remove the scallops from the grill and transfer them to a serving plate.
7. Drizzle any remaining lemon butter mixture over the scallops and garnish with fresh parsley.
8. Serve immediately and enjoy!

## Serving Suggestions
- Grilled Lemon Butter Scallops can be served as an appetizer or a main course.
- Pair them with a side of roasted vegetables or a fresh salad for a complete meal.
- Serve with a squeeze of fresh lemon juice for an extra burst of citrus flavor.

## Variations
- For a spicy kick, add a pinch of red pepper flakes to the lemon butter mixture.
- Instead of grilling, you can also cook the scallops in a hot skillet with a little olive oil.
- Experiment with different herbs and seasonings, such as thyme or paprika, to customize the flavor.

## Tips and Tricks
- Make sure to thoroughly dry the scallops before cooking to ensure a nice sear.
- Do not overcook the scallops, as they can become tough and rubbery. Cook them just until they are opaque and tender.
- If using frozen scallops, thaw them completely and pat dry before grilling.
- Use a grilling basket or skewers to prevent the scallops from falling through the grill grates.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional information for Grilled Lemon Butter Scallops may vary depending on the specific ingredients and quantities used. Here is a general breakdown per serving (4 scallops):

## Storage and Leftovers
- Grilled Lemon Butter Scallops are best enjoyed fresh off the grill. However, if you have leftovers, store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
- To reheat, gently warm the scallops in a skillet over low heat, being careful not to overcook them.

## Frequently Asked Questions
Q: Can I use frozen scallops for this recipe?
A: Yes, you can use frozen scallops. Make sure to thaw them completely and pat them dry before grilling.

Q: Can I use a grill pan instead of a grill?
A: Absolutely! A grill pan works just as well for cooking scallops.

Q: Can I substitute the lemon juice with another citrus fruit?
A: Yes, you can try using lime juice or orange juice for a different flavor profile.

Q: Can I make the lemon butter mixture in advance?
A: Yes, you can prepare the lemon butter mixture ahead of time and store it in the refrigerator. Just make sure to whisk it again before brushing it onto the scallops.

Q: How do I know when the scallops are cooked?
A: The scallops should be opaque and firm to the touch when they are cooked. Avoid overcooking them to prevent them from becoming tough.
